Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution of KR-12, human cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (83.33%) toKR-12R: 42%; I: 17%.Activity: active against E. coli K12 (MIC 30 uM).Toxicity: human RBC; some degree hemolysis (HC50 100 uM).Structure: ir is random in PBS but became helical in D8PG (see glossary).MOA:bacteria: it can permeabilize bacterial membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Mishra B, Epand RF, Epand RM, Wang G. 2013
Literature Information.Title: Structural location determines functional roles of the basic amino acids of KR-12, the smallest antimicrobial peptide from human cathelicidin LL-37
